publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7967 David Whitton: Marie Curie Cancer Care in Scotland, Great Daffodil Appeal, March 2011—That the Parliament wishes Marie Curie Cancer Care success with the 2011 Great Daffodil Appeal, which raises valuable funds that contribute to ongoing palliative care and support, free of charge, for people at the end of their lives, regardless of their illness; recognises that in 2009-10 Marie Curie Cancer Care provided free care to around 4,622 patients and their families in Scotland, and believes that terminally ill people should be able to live and die where they choose wherever possible.

S3M-7967 Marie Curie Cancer Care in Scotland, Great Daffodil Appeal, March 2011 (lodged on 18 February 2011) Jack McConnell*, Tom McCabe*, Kenneth Gibson*, John Park*, James Kelly*, Dr Richard Simpson*, Jackie Baillie*, Michael McMahon*, Jamie McGrigor*, Patricia Ferguson*, Bill Butler*, Karen Whitefield*, Claire Baker*, Andy Kerr*, Bill Wilson*, Trish Godman*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*

S3M-7967 Marie Curie Cancer Care in Scotland, Great Daffodil Appeal, March 2011 (lodged on 18 February 2011) Nanette Milne*, Elaine Murray*, Hugh O’Donnell*, George Foulkes*, Mike Pringle*, Jamie Hepburn*, Mary Mulligan*, Des McNulty*, Brian Adam*
